alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 7:24PM PDT until August 20 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SAN BERNARDINO COUNTY... At 724 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Flood report of water reaching the hoods of cars in Baker at State Route 127 and Baker Boulevard. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cima, Kelso, Mitchell Caverns, Baker, Needles, Mid Hills Campground, Mountain Pass, Hole In The Wall Campground, Black Canyon Equestrian Campground, Nipton And Ivanpah Roads, Nipton, Essex, Dumont Dunes, Sr 127 Near Dumont Dunes, Tecopa, Highway 95 And I-40 and Mohave Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
